segments.source_content: **It's flexible for Developers**: create your own design system using React components, add Visual editing in your JSX and add sidebar controls to edit props like the background color. Choose Next.js, Gatsby or Remix and any CSS framework you like!

translations.fr: **Flexible pour les dÃ©veloppeurs** : crÃ©ez votre propre design system avec des composants React, ajoutez l'Ã©dition visuelle dans votre JSX et des contrÃ´les latÃ©raux pour modifier les props comme la couleur de fond. Choisissez Next.js, Gatsby ou Remix et n'importe quel framework CSS !
translations.en: **Flexible pour les dÃ©veloppeurs** : crÃ©ez votre propre systÃ¨me de design en utilisant des composants React, ajoutez l'Ã©dition visuelle dans votre JSX et ajoutez des contrÃ´les dans la barre latÃ©rale pour modifier les props comme la couleur de fond. Choisissez Next.js, Gatsby ou Remix et n'importe quel framework CSS que vous prÃ©fÃ©rez !

segments.source_content: **It's easy for Content editors** who can directly edit in a visual way without breaking the design system: much easier than editing abstract entities using gray fields, as in a headless CMS. **And you save time**, as Content editors are autonomous!

translations.fr: **Simple pour les Ã©diteurs de contenu** qui peuvent Ã©diter visuellement sans briser le design system : bien plus facile qu'avec des champs abstraits dans un CMS headless. **Et vous gagnez du temps** car les Ã©diteurs sont autonomes !
translations.en: **Simple pour les Ã©diteurs de contenu** qui peuvent Ã©diter directement de maniÃ¨re visuelle sans casser le systÃ¨me de design : bien plus facile que de modifier des entitÃ©s abstraites avec des champs gris, comme dans un CMS headless. **Et vous gagnez du temps**, car les Ã©diteurs de contenu sont autonomes !

segments.source_content: **It's enterprise-ready** with Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, GDPR-compliant datacenters, Global CDN for optimized images, E-commerce integration, Scheduled publishing and more.

translations.fr: **PrÃªt pour l'entreprise** avec Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, centres de donnÃ©es conformes RGPD, CDN global pour images optimisÃ©es, intÃ©gration e-commerce, publication planifiÃ©e et plus encore.
translations.en: **PrÃªt pour l'entreprise** avec Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, des datacenters conformes au RGPD, CDN global pour les images optimisÃ©es, intÃ©gration e-commerce, publication planifiÃ©e et plus encore.

segments.source_content: A new minor version with a lot of improvements, including:

translations.fr: Une nouvelle version mineure avec de nombreuses amÃ©liorations, notamment :
translations.en: Une nouvelle version mineure avec de nombreuses amÃ©liorations, notamment :

segments.source_content:
- app directory improvements and bugfixes
- TypeScript plugin, great DX
- Module transpilation
- Turbopack and benchmarks improvements
- SWC plugin to transform imports
- Edge runtime now stable for API routes, and advanced middleware

translations.fr:
- AmÃ©liorations et corrections du rÃ©pertoire app
- Plugin TypeScript, excellente DX
- Transpilation de modules
- AmÃ©liorations de Turbopack et des benchmarks
- Plugin SWC pour transformer les imports
- Runtime Edge dÃ©sormais stable pour les routes API et middleware avancÃ©
translations.en:
- AmÃ©liorations et corrections de bugs du rÃ©pertoire app
- Plugin TypeScript, excellente DX
- Transpilation des modules
- AmÃ©liorations de Turbopack et des benchmarks
- Plugin SWC pour transformer les imports
- Runtime Edge dÃ©sormais stable pour les routes API, et middleware avancÃ©

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“– Beta docs [useEffectEvent](https://beta.reactjs.org/learn/separating-events-from-effects#declaring-an-effect-event): some updated doc for the newly renamed React hook. The [new site is coming in January](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1606646280649904131)!
- ğŸ“– Redux docs [Side Effects Approaches](https://twitter.com/acemarke/status/1607869290715222016): new docs page with recommendations, and comparing thunks, sagas, observables, listeners, RTQ Query...
- ğŸ“œ [React ref Callback Useâ€“Cases](https://julesblom.com/writing/ref-callback-use-cases): complete article about callback refs which allow to trigger side effects related to DOM elements. Jules presents many use cases: portals, measuring a DOM element...
- ğŸ“œ [The Ultimate Form Abstraction](https://www.brendonovich.dev/blog/the-ultimate-form-abstraction): explains how to use React-Hook-Form with a Zod resolver. Leverage the brand new Zod type-coercion feature for number inputs. Gradually build a great form abstraction with a good DX and typesafety.
- ğŸ“œ [A React Developerâ€™s First Take on Solid](https://jakelazaroff.com/words/a-react-developers-first-take-on-solid/): an interesting comparison between Solid and React, then SolidStart and Next.js/Remix. Jake also lists things he doesn't like in Solid.
- ğŸ“œ [A Review of UltraJS, Mixing React and Deno in a Single Framework](https://blog.bitsrc.io/a-review-of-ultrajs-mixing-react-and-deno-in-a-single-framework-8e4dd41ea076): this React framework for Deno pushes the latest innovations forward (ES without bundling, ImportMaps...).
- ğŸ“œ [Turbocharging Next.js: How Remote Caching decreased publish times by 80%](https://vercel.com/blog/turborepo-remote-cache-nextjs-publish-times-80-percent): feedback from Vercel, using Turborepo and Remote Caching to reduce Next.js build times, especially the native SWC binary build.
- ğŸ“œ [Hello React, Goodbye useEffect (I Hope)](https://blog.imam.dev/post/hello-react-18-goodbye-useffect): well documented article about useEffect, probably too much used in our codebases. It is above all a synchronization tool. Some inconsistencies, but worth reading.
- ğŸ“œ [Simplifying React Three Fiber with Entity Component System](https://douges.dev/blog/simplifying-r3f-with-ecs)
- ğŸ“œ [Everything you need to know about Concurrent React (with a little bit of Suspense)](https://blog.codeminer42.com/everything-you-need-to-know-about-concurrent-react-with-a-little-bit-of-suspense/)
- ğŸ¤” [Bun + new JSX 2.0 Syntax](https://twitter.com/jarredsumner/status/1609025481684422659): add support to the `<User {user} />)` syntax. A news that does not please everyone because the spec of JSX 2.0 is not finalized.
- ğŸ‘€ [Remix - CSS Modules support](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/pull/4852): PR has been merged, should be released soon.
- ğŸ“¦ [mdxjs-rs](https://github.com/wooorm/mdxjs-rs): a Rust implementation of MDX ğŸ‘Œ
- ğŸ“¦ [react-wrap-balancer](https://github.com/shuding/react-wrap-balancer): a component to balance the text of your titles on several lines (impossible in CSS). It inlines JavaScript to avoid layout shifts.
- ğŸ“¦ [react-resizable-panels](https://github.com/bvaughn/react-resizable-panels) ([demo](https://twitter.com/brian_d_vaughn/status/1605751430542925827)): a new lib from Brian Vaughn that allows you to resize elements of a layout.
- ğŸ“¦ [gltfjsx v6](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1605566666066124802): optimizations on the GLTF 3D model loader.
- ğŸ“¦ [react-ts-form](https://github.com/iway1/react-ts-form): Zod and React-Hook-Form based form lib
- ğŸ“¦ [Gatsby 5.3](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/release-notes/v5.3/)
- ğŸ“Š [Mobile Performance of Next.js Sites](https://calendar.perfplanet.com/2022/mobile-performance-of-next-js-sites/)
- ğŸ¥ [3 React Mistakes, 1 App Killer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QuLfCUh-iwI)
- ğŸ¥ [Learn with Jason - TanStack Query v4 with Dominik Dorfmeister](https://www.learnwithjason.dev/tanstack-query-v4)
- ğŸ¥ [Learn How I Built a Twitter UI with TypeScript, Qwik, SolidJS, and React in Mitosis](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=07UW3REM6k8)
- ğŸ¥ [Remotion - The Rust journey begins](https://twitter.com/JNYBGR/status/1610273808820363265)
- ğŸ‘¥ [Storybook Day user conference](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-day/): online conference on March 14, launch of Storybook 7.0

segments.source_content: Tamagui is officially out of beta, and makes it easy to create cross-platform projects (web and mobile) based on the same codebase in React, without losing on DX or performance. The project is divided into 3 parts:

translations.fr: Tamagui est officiellement sorti de la version bÃªta et facilite la crÃ©ation de projets multiplateformes (web et mobile) basÃ©s sur la mÃªme base de code en React, sans sacrifier la DX ou les performances. Le projet est divisÃ© en 3 parties :
translations.en: Tamagui est officiellement sorti de la version bÃªta et facilite la crÃ©ation de projets multiplateformes (web et mobile) basÃ©s sur la mÃªme base de code en React, sans compromettre la DX ou les performances. Le projet est divisÃ© en 3 parties :

segments.source_content:
- Tamagui Core: a CSS-in-JS runtime on top of React-Native and [React-Native-Web-Lite](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-web-lite)
- Tamagui Static: a Babel-based compiler and Node pre-evaluation that supports view flattening and atomic CSS style extraction
- Tamagui UI: a library of React components and hooks for ease of use

translations.fr:
- Tamagui Core : un runtime CSS-in-JS basÃ© sur React-Native et [React-Native-Web-Lite](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-web-lite)
- Tamagui Static : un compilateur basÃ© sur Babel et une prÃ©-Ã©valuation Node qui prend en charge l'aplatissement des vues et l'extraction de styles CSS atomiques
- Tamagui UI : une bibliothÃ¨que de composants React et de hooks pour faciliter l'utilisation
translations.en:
- Tamagui Core : un runtime CSS-in-JS basÃ© sur React-Native et [React-Native-Web-Lite](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-web-lite)
- Tamagui Static : un compilateur basÃ© sur Babel et une prÃ©-Ã©valuation Node qui prend en charge l'aplatissement des vues et l'extraction de styles CSS atomiques
- Tamagui UI : une bibliothÃ¨que de composants React et de hooks pour faciliter l'utilisation

segments.source_content: Tamagui is an innovative project with positive feedback from styling and cross-platform thought leaders. It could be interesting even if you only target one platform. The support of React 18 features like Server Components, Concurrent Mode is already there. Worth giving it a try!

translations.fr: Tamagui est un projet innovant avec des retours positifs de leaders d'opinion en matiÃ¨re de styling et de multiplateforme. Il pourrait Ãªtre intÃ©ressant mÃªme si vous ne ciblez qu'une seule plateforme. La prise en charge des fonctionnalitÃ©s de React 18 comme les Server Components et le Concurrent Mode est dÃ©jÃ  prÃ©sente. Cela vaut le coup d'essayer !
translations.en: Tamagui est un projet innovant saluÃ© par les leaders d'opinion en matiÃ¨re de stylisation et de multiplateforme. Il peut s'avÃ©rer intÃ©ressant mÃªme si vous ne ciblez qu'une seule plateforme. La prise en charge des fonctionnalitÃ©s de React 18 comme les Server Components et le Concurrent Mode est dÃ©jÃ  intÃ©grÃ©e. Cela vaut le coup d'essayer !

translations.fr: **[React Native Skia : Bilan d'une annÃ©e et perspectives](https://shopify.engineering/react-native-skia-2022)**
translations.en: **[React Native Skia : RÃ©trospective d'une annÃ©e et perspectives](https://shopify.engineering/react-native-skia-2022)**

segments.source_content: William Candillon makes a nice retrospective of the React-Native-Skia project. As a reminder, [Skia](https://skia.org/) is Google's 2D engine, used by Chrome, Android, Flutter... They have significantly improved the performance with UI Thread Rendering and a new declarative Skia DOM API. The library is flexible and can be extended (Skottie, VisionCamera frame processing). In 2023, we can expect to see animations via worklets, a more powerful integration with Reanimated, or text layout.

translations.fr: William Candillon dresse un beau bilan rÃ©trospectif du projet React-Native-Skia. Pour rappel, [Skia](https://skia.org/) est le moteur 2D de Google, utilisÃ© par Chrome, Android, Flutter... Ils ont considÃ©rablement amÃ©liorÃ© les performances avec le rendu sur le thread UI et une nouvelle API dÃ©clarative Skia DOM. La bibliothÃ¨que est flexible et peut Ãªtre Ã©tendue (Skottie, traitement d'images VisionCamera). En 2023, nous pouvons nous attendre Ã  voir des animations via des worklets, une intÃ©gration plus puissante avec Reanimated ou la mise en page de texte.
translations.en: William Candillon propose une belle rÃ©trospective du projet React-Native-Skia. Pour rappel, [Skia](https://skia.org/) est le moteur 2D de Google, utilisÃ© par Chrome, Android, Flutter... Les performances ont Ã©tÃ© significativement amÃ©liorÃ©es avec le rendu sur le thread UI et une nouvelle API dÃ©clarative Skia DOM. La bibliothÃ¨que est flexible et extensible (Skottie, traitement d'images VisionCamera). En 2023, on peut s'attendre Ã  des animations via les worklets, une intÃ©gration renforcÃ©e avec Reanimated ou la mise en page de texte.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“Š [State of React-Native 2022](https://twitter.com/swmansion/status/1605957585684799493): the survey is open. I'll send a dedicated email soon because it's important that you answer it ğŸ˜œ
- ğŸ“œ [First-class Support for TypeScript](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2023/01/03/typescript-first): React-Native 0.71 should be released very soon with full TypeScript support by default: type definitions, documentation and starter template.
- ğŸ“œ [Shopify - Migrating our Largest Mobile App to React Native](https://shopify.engineering/migrating-our-largest-mobile-app-to-react-native): Shopify is in the process of incrementally migrating their main app to React-Native. It's a 6 years old app with more than 300 screens, with no particular technical debt. A very interesting feedback on this ongoing migration (still in the beginning, around 10% done). The first approach (new features in React-Native) had not worked. They finally opted to convert the root of the app first.
- ğŸ“œ [Implementing CSS Style Inheritance in React Native](https://www.builder.io/blog/implementing-css-style-inheritance-in-react-native): explains how to reproduce the CSS cascade in React-Native, a CSS behavior not implemented for good reasons. This is especially useful for integration with a CMS, which often assumes that you can apply text styling to a parent View, like it's possible on the web.
- ğŸ“œ [Google Drive auto-backup for React Native on Android](https://dev.to/retyui/google-drive-auto-backup-for-react-native-on-android-254a): to persist the async storage (or whatever) from one phone to another.
- ğŸ¥ [How to use Bluetooth Low Energy ( BLE ) Beacons with React-Native](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1hYM_sdQcBU)

C'est particuliÃ¨rement utile pour l'intÃ©gration avec un CMS, qui suppose souvent que vous pouvez appliquer un style de texte Ã  une View parente, comme c'est possible sur le web.
